New Records: Adolis Garcia set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15
Adolis Garcia tied for fourth-longest home run streak in postseason history
Key Match Events: Corey Seager hit a long home run in the first inning
Adolis Garcia homered twice and drove in five runs
Texas led the AL West for most of the year, only to squander the division crown to Houston with a loss at Seattle on the final day of the regular season
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy, who came out of retirement this season to manage the Rangers, became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams
Meanwhile, the defending World Series champion Astros were finally dethroned
Miscellaneous Highlights: Texas led the AL West for most of the year, only to squander the division crown to Houston with a loss at Seattle on the final day of the regular season
Turns out, that was no problem. They have gone 8-0 away from home in these playoffs, joining the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason
Others: Jordan Montgomery, normally a starter, came out of the bullpen on two days' rest and pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win
Max Scherzer, acquired from the Mets in July, allowed four hits and two runs with two walks in 2 2/3 innings
